meanings.sent1: The outfit she wore to the party was so naff.
meanings.sent2: The store was filled with naff clothes that nobody wanted to buy.
meanings.sent3: He tried to impress everyone with his naff dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The naff decorations made the room look like a circus.
meanings.sent5: The naff design of the building made it stand out for all the wrong reasons.

meanings.definition: To be of poor quality or taste
meanings.sent1: I hope the food at the restaurant doesn't naff.
meanings.sent2: The cheap materials used in the toy made it naff.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to cook dinner ended up being a naff disaster.
meanings.sent4: The movie's plot naffed the entire viewing experience.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was naffed by rushed brush strokes.

meanings.sent1: Please don't naff the surprise party for Sarah.
meanings.sent2: The rain threatened to naff our picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: His constant interruptions naffed the flow of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The negative comments naffed the mood of the celebration.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti naffed the beauty of the historic building.
